security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation and validation framework for code quality. Contains one Python script that runs other validation scripts via subprocess. All execution is constrained to the project directory with hardcoded paths. No network access or sensitive data handling. Risk is low due to limited, controlled execution scope.

content.value_statement: Software projects need systematic quality checkpoints to prevent bugs and security issues from reaching production. This skill provides a complete framework with automated validation scripts that run TypeScript, security, testing, and pattern checks at each development stage.
actual_capabilities: Validates TypeScript strict mode compliance (no any types, explicit function types)
Checks for security vulnerabilities (hardcoded secrets, SQL injection, XSS)
Enforces test coverage thresholds (75% overall, 90% for business logic)
Runs automated validation scripts across multiple quality dimensions
Provides checkpoint framework for pre-implementation through review gates
Validates input schemas with Zod patterns and authorization checks
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files directly
Validator scripts must exist in .claude/skills subdirectories to function
Does not integrate with CI/CD pipelines or external build systems
Coverage thresholds are project-wide, not granular to individual modules

use_cases.title: Standardize code quality
use_cases.description: Ensure all team members follow consistent TypeScript, testing, and security patterns across projects.

use_cases.title: Validate AI-generated code
use_cases.description: Check AI-generated code against organizational standards before submission or deployment.

use_cases.title: Automated pre-review checks
use_cases.description: Run consistent validation checks before manual code review to catch obvious issues early.

prompt_templates.title: Run quality gates
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the quality-gates validation script to check if all gates pass. Report which validators passed and which failed.

prompt_templates.title: Check test coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify that test coverage meets the required thresholds: 75% overall, 90% for services and utils directories.

prompt_templates.title: Security scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Run security validation to check for hardcoded secrets, missing input validation, and SQL injection risks in the code.

prompt_templates.title: TypeScript strictness
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate that all functions have explicit types, no @ts-ignore comments, and no any types are used in the code.

output: All quality gates PASSED. Ready to proceed.

best_practices: Run quality gates BEFORE starting implementation to understand all requirements and plan your approach.
Check implementation gates DURING coding to catch issues early when they are cheaper to fix.
Run the full validation suite before requesting code review to ensure a clean submission.
Never bypass gates without explicit approval. Document any exceptions with clear justification.
anti_patterns: Skipping quality gates to save time and submitting code with issues that could have been caught early.
Writing tests AFTER implementation instead of following TDD red-green-refactor cycle.
Using any types or @ts-ignore to silence TypeScript errors instead of properly typing code.
Submitting code without verifying test coverage meets the required thresholds.

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for automated code validation and quality enforcement.

faq.question: What are the minimum coverage requirements?
faq.answer: 75% overall coverage required. Business logic (services/utils) requires 90%. API routes require 75%. UI components require 60%.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my build process?
faq.answer: Run .claude/skills/quality-gates/validate.py as a pre-commit hook or in your CI pipeline before builds.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All validation runs locally on your machine. No network requests are made by the validation scripts.

faq.question: What if a validator script fails?
faq.answer: Fix the specific issue flagged by the validator. Do not bypass gates. Run validate.py again after making corrections.

faq.question: How does this compare to ESLint?
faq.answer: This complements ESLint with project-specific rules, security checks, test coverage enforcement, and architectural pattern validation.
